title: RSQLite
text: create new SQLite database, simply supply filename dbConnect(): just need temporary database, use either "" (-disk database) ":memory:" "file::memory:" (-memory database). database automatically deleted disconnect .
code: mydb <- dbConnect(RSQLite::SQLite(), "my-db.sqlite") dbDisconnect(mydb) mydb <- dbConnect(RSQLite::SQLite(), "") dbDisconnect(mydb)

title: RSQLite
text: can easily copy R data frame SQLite database dbWriteTable():
code: mydb <- dbConnect(RSQLite::SQLite(), "") dbWriteTable(mydb, "mtcars", mtcars) dbWriteTable(mydb, "iris", iris) dbListTables(mydb) #> [1] "iris"   "mtcars"

title: RSQLite
text: Issue query dbGetQuery(): R variable names valid SQL variable names, may need escape ": need insert value user query, don’t use paste()! makes easy malicious attacker insert SQL might damage database reveal sensitive information. Instead, use parameterised query: little typing, much much safer.
code: dbGetQuery(mydb, 'SELECT * FROM mtcars LIMIT 5') #>    mpg cyl disp  hp drat    wt  qsec vs am gear carb #> 1 21.0   6  160 110 3.90 2.620 16.46  0  1    4    4 #> 2 21.0   6  160 110 3.90 2.875 17.02  0  1    4    4 #> 3 22.8   4  108  93 3.85 2.320 18.61  1  1    4    1 #> 4 21.4   6  258 110 3.08 3.215 19.44  1  0    3    1 #> 5 18.7   8  360 175 3.15 3.440 17.02  0  0    3    2 dbGetQuery(mydb, 'SELECT * FROM iris WHERE "Sepal.Length" < 4.6') #>   Sepal.Length Sepal.Width Petal.Length Petal.Width Species #> 1          4.4         2.9          1.4         0.2  setosa #> 2          4.3         3.0          1.1         0.1  setosa #> 3          4.4         3.0          1.3         0.2  setosa #> 4          4.5         2.3          1.3         0.3  setosa #> 5          4.4         3.2          1.3         0.2  setosa dbGetQuery(mydb, 'SELECT * FROM iris WHERE "Sepal.Length" < :x',   params = list(x = 4.6)) #>   Sepal.Length Sepal.Width Petal.Length Petal.Width Species #> 1          4.4         2.9          1.4         0.2  setosa #> 2          4.3         3.0          1.1         0.1  setosa #> 3          4.4         3.0          1.3         0.2  setosa #> 4          4.5         2.3          1.3         0.3  setosa #> 5          4.4         3.2          1.3         0.2  setosa

title: RSQLite
text: run query results don’t fit memory, can use dbSendQuery(), dbFetch() dbClearResults() retrieve results batches. default dbFetch() retrieve available rows: use n set maximum number rows return.
code: rs <- dbSendQuery(mydb, 'SELECT * FROM mtcars') while (!dbHasCompleted(rs)) {   df <- dbFetch(rs, n = 10)   print(nrow(df)) } #> [1] 10 #> [1] 10 #> [1] 10 #> [1] 2 dbClearResult(rs)

title: RSQLite
text: can use approach run parameterised query different parameters. Call dbBind() set parameters: can also pass multiple parameters one call dbBind():
code: rs <- dbSendQuery(mydb, 'SELECT * FROM iris WHERE "Sepal.Length" < :x') dbBind(rs, params = list(x = 4.5)) nrow(dbFetch(rs)) #> [1] 4 dbBind(rs, params = list(x = 4)) nrow(dbFetch(rs)) #> [1] 0 dbClearResult(rs) rs <- dbSendQuery(mydb, 'SELECT * FROM iris WHERE "Sepal.Length" = :x') dbBind(rs, params = list(x = seq(4, 4.4, by = 0.1))) nrow(dbFetch(rs)) #> [1] 4 dbClearResult(rs)

title: RSQLite
text: DBI new functions dbSendStatement() dbExecute(), counterparts dbSendQuery() dbGetQuery() SQL statements return tabular result, inserting records table, updating table, setting engine parameters. good practice, although currently enforced, use new functions don’t expect result.
code: dbExecute(mydb, 'DELETE FROM iris WHERE "Sepal.Length" < 4') #> [1] 0 rs <- dbSendStatement(mydb, 'DELETE FROM iris WHERE "Sepal.Length" < :x') dbBind(rs, params = list(x = 4.5)) dbGetRowsAffected(rs) #> [1] 4 dbClearResult(rs)

title: SQLite Interface for R
text: Embeds SQLite database engine R, providing DBI-compliant interface. SQLite public-domain, single-user, light-weight database engine implements decent subset SQL 92 standard, including core table creation, updating, insertion, selection operations, plus transaction management. can install latest released version CRAN : install latest development version GitHub : Discussions associated DBI related database packages take place R-SIG-DB. website Databases using R describes tools best practices ecosystem.
code: install.packages("RSQLite") # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("r-dbi/RSQLite")

title: SQLite Interface for R
code: library(DBI) # Create an ephemeral in-memory RSQLite database con <- dbConnect(RSQLite::SQLite(), ":memory:")  dbListTables(con) ## character(0) dbWriteTable(con, "mtcars", mtcars) dbListTables(con) ## [1] "mtcars" dbListFields(con, "mtcars") ##  [1] "mpg"  "cyl"  "disp" "hp"   "drat" "wt"   "qsec" "vs"   "am"   "gear" ## [11] "carb" dbReadTable(con, "mtcars") ##    mpg cyl  disp  hp drat    wt  qsec vs am gear carb ## 1 21.0   6 160.0 110 3.90 2.620 16.46  0  1    4    4 ## 2 21.0   6 160.0 110 3.90 2.875 17.02  0  1    4    4 ## 3 22.8   4 108.0  93 3.85 2.320 18.61  1  1    4    1 ## 4 21.4   6 258.0 110 3.08 3.215 19.44  1  0    3    1 ## 5 18.7   8 360.0 175 3.15 3.440 17.02  0  0    3    2 ## 6 18.1   6 225.0 105 2.76 3.460 20.22  1  0    3    1 ## 7 14.3   8 360.0 245 3.21 3.570 15.84  0  0    3    4 ## 8 24.4   4 146.7  62 3.69 3.190 20.00  1  0    4    2 ## 9 22.8   4 140.8  95 3.92 3.150 22.90  1  0    4    2 ##  [ reached 'max' / getOption("max.print") -- omitted 23 rows ] # You can fetch all results: res <- dbSendQuery(con, "SELECT * FROM mtcars WHERE cyl = 4") dbFetch(res) ##    mpg cyl  disp hp drat    wt  qsec vs am gear carb ## 1 22.8   4 108.0 93 3.85 2.320 18.61  1  1    4    1 ## 2 24.4   4 146.7 62 3.69 3.190 20.00  1  0    4    2 ## 3 22.8   4 140.8 95 3.92 3.150 22.90  1  0    4    2 ## 4 32.4   4  78.7 66 4.08 2.200 19.47  1  1    4    1 ## 5 30.4   4  75.7 52 4.93 1.615 18.52  1  1    4    2 ## 6 33.9   4  71.1 65 4.22 1.835 19.90  1  1    4    1 ## 7 21.5   4 120.1 97 3.70 2.465 20.01  1  0    3    1 ## 8 27.3   4  79.0 66 4.08 1.935 18.90  1  1    4    1 ## 9 26.0   4 120.3 91 4.43 2.140 16.70  0  1    5    2 ##  [ reached 'max' / getOption("max.print") -- omitted 2 rows ] dbClearResult(res)  # Or a chunk at a time res <- dbSendQuery(con, "SELECT * FROM mtcars WHERE cyl = 4") while (!dbHasCompleted(res)) {   chunk <- dbFetch(res, n = 5)   print(nrow(chunk)) } ## [1] 5 ## [1] 5 ## [1] 1 # Clear the result dbClearResult(res)  # Disconnect from the database dbDisconnect(con)

title: Connect to an SQLite database — SQLite
code: SQLite(...)  # S4 method for class 'SQLiteConnection' dbConnect(drv, ...)  # S4 method for class 'SQLiteDriver' dbConnect(   drv,   dbname = "",   ...,   loadable.extensions = TRUE,   default.extensions = loadable.extensions,   cache_size = NULL,   synchronous = "off",   flags = SQLITE_RWC,   vfs = NULL,   bigint = c("integer64", "integer", "numeric", "character"),   extended_types = FALSE )  # S4 method for class 'SQLiteConnection' dbDisconnect(conn, ...)

title: Connect to an SQLite database — SQLite
text: ... previous versions, SQLite() took arguments. now moved DBI::dbConnect(), arguments ignored warning. drv, conn objected generated SQLite(), existing SQLiteConnection. connection, connection cloned. dbname path database file. SQLite keeps database instance one single file. name database file name, thus database names legal file names running platform. two exceptions: "" create temporary -disk database. file deleted connection closed. ":memory:" "file::memory:" create temporary -memory database. loadable.extensions TRUE (default) SQLite3 loadable extensions enabled. Setting value FALSE prevents extensions loaded. default.extensions TRUE (default) initExtension() function called new connection.Setting value FALSE requires calling initExtension() manually. cache_size Advanced option. positive integer change maximum number disk pages SQLite holds memory (SQLite's default 2000 pages). See https://www.sqlite.org/pragma.html#pragma_cache_size details. synchronous Advanced options. Possible values synchronous "" (default), "normal",  "full".  Users reported significant speed ups using sychronous = "", SQLite documentation implies considerable improved performance modest risk database corruption unlikely case operating system (R application) crashing. See https://www.sqlite.org/pragma.html#pragma_synchronous details. flags SQLITE_RWC: open database read/write mode create database file already exist; SQLITE_RW: open database read/write mode. Raise error file already exist; SQLITE_RO: open database read mode.  Raise error file already exist vfs Select SQLite3 OS interface. See https://www.sqlite.org/vfs.html details. Allowed values "unix-posix", "unix-unix-afp", "unix-unix-flock", "unix-dotfile", "unix-none". bigint R type 64-bit integer types mapped , default bit64::integer64, allows full range 64 bit integers. extended_types TRUE columns type DATE, DATETIME / TIMESTAMP, TIME mapped corresponding R-classes, c.f. details. Defaults FALSE.

title: Write a local data frame or file to the database — dbWriteTable_SQLiteConnection_character_character
text: conn SQLiteConnection object, produced DBI::dbConnect() name character string specifying table name. SQLite table names case sensitive, e.g., table names ABC abc considered equal. value data.frame (coercible data.frame) object file name (character).  first case, data.frame written temporary file imported SQLite; value character, interpreted file name contents imported SQLite. ... Needed compatibility generic. Otherwise ignored. field.types character vector named  SQL field types names names new table's columns. missing, types inferred DBI::dbDataType()). overwrite logical specifying whether overwrite existing table . default FALSE. append logical specifying whether append existing table DBMS.  default FALSE. header logical indicating whether first data line (see skip) header .  missing, value determined following read.table() convention, namely, set TRUE first row one fewer field number columns. colClasses Character vector R type names, used override defaults imputing classes -disk file. row.names logical specifying whether row.names output output DBMS table; TRUE, extra field whose name whatever R identifier "row.names" maps DBMS (see DBI::make.db.names()). NA add rows names characters, otherwise ignore. nrows Number rows read determine types. sep field separator, defaults ','. eol end--line delimiter, defaults '\n'. skip number lines skip reading data. Defaults 0. temporary logical specifying whether new table temporary. default FALSE.

title: Add useful extension functions — initExtension
text: db SQLiteConnection object load extensions . extension extension load.

title: Add useful extension functions — initExtension
text: "math" extension functions written Liam Healy made available SQLite website (https://www.sqlite.org/contrib). package contains slightly modified version original code. See section "Available functions math extension" details. "regexp" extension provides regular-expression matcher POSIX extended regular expressions, available SQLite source code repository (https://sqlite.org/src/file?filename=ext/misc/regexp.c). SQLite implement regexp B operator, string matched B regular expression. "series" extension loads table-valued function generate_series(), available SQLite source code repository (https://sqlite.org/src/file?filename=ext/misc/series.c). "csv" extension loads function csv() can used create virtual tables, available SQLite source code repository (https://sqlite.org/src/file?filename=ext/misc/csv.c).

title: SQLite transaction management — dbBegin_SQLiteConnection
text: default, SQLite auto-commit mode. dbBegin() starts SQLite transaction turns auto-commit . dbCommit() dbRollback() commit rollback transaction, respectively turn auto-commit . DBI::dbWithTransaction() convenient wrapper makes sure dbCommit() dbRollback() called. helper function sqliteIsTransacting() available check current transaction status connection.

title: SQLite transaction management — dbBegin_SQLiteConnection
text: conn SQLiteConnection object, produced DBI::dbConnect() .name backward compatibility, use. ... Needed compatibility generic. Otherwise ignored. name Supply name use named savepoint. allows nest multiple transaction

title: SQLite transaction management — dbBegin_SQLiteConnection
code: library(DBI) con <- dbConnect(SQLite(), ":memory:") dbWriteTable(con, "arrests", datasets::USArrests) dbGetQuery(con, "select count(*) from arrests") #>   count(*) #> 1       50  dbBegin(con) rs <- dbSendStatement(con, "DELETE from arrests WHERE Murder > 1") dbGetRowsAffected(rs) #> [1] 49 dbClearResult(rs)  dbGetQuery(con, "select count(*) from arrests") #>   count(*) #> 1        1  dbRollback(con) dbGetQuery(con, "select count(*) from arrests")[1, ] #> [1] 50  dbBegin(con) rs <- dbSendStatement(con, "DELETE FROM arrests WHERE Murder > 5") dbClearResult(rs) dbCommit(con) dbGetQuery(con, "SELECT count(*) FROM arrests")[1, ] #> [1] 16  # Named savepoints can be nested -------------------------------------------- dbBegin(con, name = "a") dbBegin(con, name = "b") sqliteIsTransacting(con) #> [1] TRUE dbRollback(con, name = "b") dbCommit(con, name = "a")  dbDisconnect(con)

what: Configure what SQLite should do when the database is locked — sqliteSetBusyHandler
title: Configure what SQLite should do when the database is locked — sqliteSetBusyHandler
text: transaction lock database, already locked another one, SQLite default throws error: database locked. behavior usually appropriate concurrent access needed, typically multiple processes write database. sqliteSetBusyHandler() lets set timeout handler events. setting timeout, SQLite try transaction multiple times within timeout. set timeout, pass integer scalar sqliteSetBusyHandler(). Another way set timeout use PRAGMA, e.g. SQL query   sets busy timeout three seconds.
code: PRAGMA busy_timeout=3000

title: Configure what SQLite should do when the database is locked — sqliteSetBusyHandler
code: sqliteSetBusyHandler(dbObj, handler)

title: Configure what SQLite should do when the database is locked — sqliteSetBusyHandler
text: dbObj SQLiteConnection object. handler Specifies database locked another transaction. can : NULL: fail immediately, integer scalar: timeout milliseconds corresponds PRAGMA busy_timeout, R function: function called one argument, see details .

title: Configure what SQLite should do when the database is locked — sqliteSetBusyHandler
text: Invisible NULL.

title: Configure what SQLite should do when the database is locked — sqliteSetBusyHandler
text: Note SQLite currently schedule concurrent transactions fairly. multiple transactions waiting database, one can granted access next. Moreover, SQLite currently ensure access granted soon database available. Make sure set busy timeout high enough value applications high concurrency many writes. handler argument function, used callback function. database locked, called single integer, number calls locking event. callback function must return integer scalar. returns 0L, additional attempts made access database, error thrown. Otherwise another attempt made access database cycle repeats. Handler callbacks useful debugging concurrent behavior, implement sophisticated busy algorithm. latter currently considered experimental RSQLite. callback function fails, RSQLite print warning, transaction aborted "database locked" error. Note every database connection busy timeout handler function. Calling sqliteSetBusyHandler() connection connected error.

title: RSQLite 2.0 (2017-06-18)
text: Updated embedded SQLite 3.19.3. 64-bit integers returned integer64 vectors. bit64 package imported support data type (#65). row.names argument dbFetch(), dbReadTable(), dbWriteTable(), sqliteBuildTableDefinition(), sqlData() now defaults FALSE. (also affects dbGetQuery().) old default can restored temporarily per-package basis calling pkgconfig::set_config("RSQLite::row.names.query" = NA). NULL valid value row.names argument, FALSE (#210). name argument dbBegin(), dbCommit(), dbRollback() now declared ellipsis. Code calls methods unnamed second argument still works receives warning (#208). select.cols argument dbReadTable() deprecated, use dbGetQuery() SELECT query instead (#185). methods related tables (dbReadTable(), dbWriteTable(), dbExistsTable(), dbRemoveTable()) always treat name argument literal name, even contains backticks. breaks CRAN version (GitHub version) sqldf package (#188). dbWriteTable(append = TRUE) raises error column names data existing table (#165). dbFetch() now errs n < -1, accepts n == Inf. Removed dummy dbGetQuery() method introduced compatibility Bioconductor packages (#187). sqlData() now returns quoted strings, like default implementation DBI (#207). dbWriteTable() returns invisibly. Now returning objects type blob blobs (#189). dbGetRowsAffected() now returns NA statement placeholders, dbBind() called. column contains incompatible values (e.g., numbers strings), warning raised dbFetch() (#161). Failing set PRAGMA cache_size PRAGMA synchronous dbConnect() now gives clear warning (#197). Improve warning message named parameters used dbGetPreparedQuery() dbSendPreparedQuery() (#193). SQLite collects additional histogram data ANALYZE, may lead faster executions queries (#124).

title: RSQLite 2.0 (2017-06-18)

Fix corner case repeatedly fetching columns don’t affinity. variance() stdev() extension functions now return NULL input length 1 (#201). Fix roundtrip raw columns (#116).

Remove Makevars.local logic, resolve installation issues non-GNU Make (#203). methods DBI reexported. Registering native functions, required R >= 3.4.0. Use UTF-8 encoded file names required SQLite API, support non-ASCII file names (#211). Calling dbFetch(n = 0) instead dbFetch(n = 1) dbListFields(). Exclude SQLite3 source code coverage computation (#204).

title: RSQLite 1.1 (2016-11-25)
text: RSQLite always builds included source, located src/sqlite3. prevents bugs due API mismatches considerably simplifies build process. Current version: 3.11.1. Enable JSON1 extension (#152, @tigertoes). Include support FTS5 (@mkuhn). Compilation limits SQLITE_MAX_VARIABLE_NUMBER SQLITE_MAX_COLUMN reset defaults. documentation suggests setting high values bad idea. Header files sqlite3 longer installed, linking package possible anymore. Packages require access low-level sqlite3 API bundle copy.

title: RSQLite 1.1 (2016-11-25)
text: RSQLite() longer automatically attaches DBI loaded. encourage use library(DBI); dbConnect(RSQLite::SQLite()). Functions take table name, dbWriteTable() dbReadTable(), now quote table name via dbQuoteIdentifier(). means caller-quoted names marked DBI::SQL().

title: RSQLite 1.1 (2016-11-25)
text: RSQLite rewritten (essentially scratch) C++ Rcpp. considerably reduced amount code, allows us take advantage sophisticated memory management tools available Rcpp. rewrite yield minor performance improvements, importantly protect memory leaks crashes. also provides better base future development. particular, now technically possible multiple result sets per connection, although feature currently disabled (#150). can now use SQLite’s URL specification databases. allows create shared -memory databases (#70). Queries (#69), query parameters table data always converted UTF-8 sent database. Adapted DBI 0.5, new code use dbExecute() instead dbGetQuery(), dbSendStatement() instead dbSendQuery() appropriate. New strategy prepared queries. Create prepared query dbSendQuery() dbSendStatement() bind values dbBind(). query/statement can executed efficiently multiple times passing data-frame-like object (#168, #178, #181). dbSendQuery(), dbGetQuery(), dbSendStatement() dbExecute() also support inline parameterised queries, like dbGetQuery(datasetsDb(), "SELECT * mtcars cyl = :cyl",   params = list(cyl = 4)). performance benefits protects SQL injection attacks. Improve column type inference: first non-NULL value decides type column (#111). non-NULL values, column affinity used, determined according sqlite3 rules (#160). dbFetch() uses row name strategy dbReadTable() (#53). dbColumnInfo() now return information even ’ve retrieved data. New sqliteVersion() prints header library versions RSQLite. Deprecation warnings given , clear reference source. datasetsDb() now returns read-database, avoid modifications installed file.

title: RSQLite 1.1 (2016-11-25)
text: make.db.names() formally deprecated. Please use dbQuoteIdentifier() instead. function also used dbReadTable(), dbRemoveTable(), dbListFields() (#106, #132). sqliteBuildTableDefinition() deprecated. Use DBI::sqlCreateTable() instead. dbGetException() now raises deprecation warning always returns list(errorNum = 0L, errorMsg = "OK"), querying last SQLite error works error actually occurred (#129). dbSendPreparedQuery() dbGetPreparedQuery() reimplemented (deprecation warning) using dbSendQuery(), dbBind() dbFetch() compatibility existing packages (#100, #153, #168, #181). Please convert new API, old function may removed completely soon: never part official API, less argument checking new APIs. dbSendPreparedQuery() dbGetPreparedQuery() ignore parameters found query, warning (#174). Reimplemented dbListResults() (deprecation warning) compatibility existing packages (#154). Soft-deprecated dbGetInfo(): “Result” method implemented DBI, methods classes raise warning (#137). ’s now better access metadata individual functions dbHasCompleted(), dbGetRowCount() dbGetRowsAffected(). summary() methods removed: information now displayed show() methods, previously pretty useless.

Reexporting dbGetQuery() dbDriver() (#147, #148, #183). sqliteCopyDatabase() accepts character argument , case temporary connection opened. Reimplemented dbWriteTable("SQLiteConnection", "character", "character") import CSV files, using function old codebase (#151). dbWriteTable("SQLiteConnection", "character", "data.frame") looks table names already enclosed backticks uses , (warning), compatibility sqldf package.

Enabled AppVeyor testing. Differential reverse dependency checks. Added upgrade script sqlite3 sources creation script datasets database data-raw directory.

title: RSQLite 1.0.0 (2014-10-25)
text: Updated SQLite 3.8.6 Added datasetsDb(), bundled SQLite database containing data frames datasets package (#15). Inlined RSQLite.extfuns - use initExtension() load many useful extension functions (#44). Methods longer automatically clone connection open result set. implement inconsistently handful places (#22). RSQLite now forgiving forget close result set - close , warning. ’s still good practice clean , don’t . dbBegin(), dbCommit(), dbRollback() throw errors failure, rather return FALSE. gain name argument specify named savepoints. dbFetch() method added (fetch() deprecated future) dbRemoveTable() throws errors failure, rather returning FALSE. dbWriteTable() rewritten: quotes field names using dbQuoteIdentifier(), rather use flawed black-list based approach name munging. now throws errors failure, rather returning FALSE. automatically add row names character, integer. loading file disk, dbWriteTable() longer attempt guess correct values row.names header - instead supply explicitly defaults incorrect. uses named save points can nested inside transactions (#41). given zero-row data frame just creates table definition (#35).

Please use dbBegin() instead. dbCallProc() method removed, since generic now deprecated. Renamed dbBuildTableDefinition() sqliteBuildTableDefinition() avoid implying ’s DBI generic. Old function aliased new warning. dbFetch() longer numbers row names sequentially fetches. safe.write() longer exported shouldn’t part public RSQLite interface (#26). Internal sqlite*() functions longer exported (#20). Removed SqliteObject dbObject classes, modifying SqliteDriver, SqliteConnection, SqliteResult use composition instead multiple inheritance.

title: Version 0.11.0
text: Enhance type detection sqliteDataType (dbDataType). storage mode data.frame column now used part type detection. Prior patch, vectors class numeric logical mapped TEXT column. patch uses output storage.mode map integer double vectors INTEGER REAL columns, respectively. modes mapped TEXT column. Detection BLOBs narrowed slightly. code now treats objects data.class(obj) == “list” BLOBs. Previously, .list used return TRUE lists various classes. Fix bug sqliteImportFile (used dbWriteTable) prevented comment character specified input file. Increase compile-time SQLite limits maximum number columns table 30000 maximum number parameters (?N) SELECT 40000. Use wide tables encouraged. default values SQLite 2000 999, respectively. Databases containing tables 2000 columns may compatible versions SQLite compiled default settings. Upgrade SQLite 3.7.9.

title: Version 0.9-1
text: SQLite header files needed compile SQLite extension functions now made available RSQLite. Packages can bundle SQLite extension functions use LinkingTo: RSQLite DESCRIPTION file. SQLite loadable extensions now enabled default new connections. wish disallow loadable extensions given connection, loadable.extensions=FALSE dbConnect.

title: Version 0.9-0
text: SQLite driver handle validation code, is_ValidHandle, longer requires driver ID equal current process ID. SQLite supports multiple processes accessing SQLite file via locking (however, results known unreliable NFS). change make using RSQLite multicore package easier. example issue PID check causes see: https://stat.ethz.ch/pipermail/r-sig-hpc/2009-August/000335.html Refactor use external pointers wrap handle IDs; remove handle ID coerce code (e.g. (obj@Id, “integer”)). now, old scheme storing handle IDs integer vector mostly maintained integer vectors stored protection slot external pointer. Using external pointers allow use finalizer code , example, unreferenced result sets can cleaned . Upgrade SQLite 3.6.23.1. memory management code keeping track database connections significantly refactored. Instead tracking connections pre-allocated array attached driver manager, connections now managed dynamically using R’s external pointers finalizers. Consequences change follows: longer maximum connection limit (values specified using max.con argument SQLite() now ignored). dbGetInfo(mgr) method longer lists open connections dbListConnections now always return empty list. functionality needed one needed reference connection order finalize resource via dbDisconnect(). calling dbDisconnect() still recommended approach, database connections longer referenced R variables finalized R’s garbage collector. behavior SQLiteConnection objects now follows typical R semantics. R variables reference given connection, finalized R’s garbage collector. Add support SQLite BLOBs. can now insert retrieve BLOBs using raw vectors. parameterized queries using dbSendPreparedQuery, BLOB column must list. query returns result set BLOB column, column list raw vectors. Lists columns data.frames work simple access, may break code expects columns atomic vectors. database NULL value mapped R NULL value BLOBs. differs mapping database NULL NA used datatypes (notion NA raw vector). behavior dbDataType, sqliteDataType, consequence, dbWriteTable changed support BLOBs represented column type list data.frame. columns previously mapped TEXT column SQLite mapped BLOB. RSQLite now depends R >= 2.10.0.

title: Version 0.8-4
text: Fix memory leak bound parameter management resolve missing PROTECT bug caused spurious crashes performing many prepared queries. Improve internal memory handling prepared queries. Use R_PreserveObject/R_ReleaseObject instead protection stack manage parameter binding. Logical vectors now properly coerced integer vectors Rf_asCharacterFactor used convert factors bind data. RSQLite now requires DBI >= 0.2-5 now fairly comprehensive example using prepared queries man page dbSendQuery-methods. Upgrade SQLite 3.6.21 => 3.6.22 (minor bug fixes). Use sqlite3_prepare_v2 throughout, remove workaround code needed legacy sqlite3_prepare behavior. Add name space unload hook unload RSQLite.. Enable full-text search module default. See https://www.sqlite.org/fts3.html details SQLite module. Add support prepared queries involve SELECT. previously unsupported. SELECT queries can now used dbSendPreparedQuery. return value rbind’ing results individual queries. means parameters return results ignored result.

title: Version 0.8-3

title: Version 0.8-2
text: Changes support WIN64

title: Version 0.8-1
text: sqliteFetch now returns data.frame expected number columns query returns zero rows. , 0 x 0 data.frame returned regardless number columns original query. change seen calls fetch dbGetQuery queries return result rows. sqliteCopyDatabase refactored support copying either file open empty database connection. makes possible transfer disk based database -memory based database. changes sqliteCopyDatabase BACKWARDS COMPATIBLE: return value now NULL (error raised copying fails) argument names changed ‘’ ‘’. newly added feature uses experimental SQLite API, decided disregards compatibility. Calling dbSendPreparedQuery non-NULL bind.data zero rows zero columns now error.

title: Version 0.8-0
text: Upgrade SQLite 3.6.21 Apply code Rd cleanups contributed Mattias Burger. Avoid partial argument name matching, use TRUE/FALSE T/F improve Rd markup. Integrate RUnit unit tests run R CMD check. Small improvements make tests run quietly. can run unit tests calling RSQLite:::.test_RSQLite() (require latest version RUnit package). Also disable unit tests Windows. Investigation details TODO list. Add sqliteCopyDatabase, function uses SQLite’s online backup API allow specified database copied file. can used create file copy memory database. Increase default max connections 16 200 SQLite(). Connections SQLite inexpensive longer hard-coded limit number connections can . However, memory allocated driver initialization time based maximum, best use large values unless really need connections. sqliteTransactionStatement, used dbCommit, dbRollback, dbBeginTransaction, now passes silent=TRUE try() suppress error messages. Without , code otherwise handle failed commit gracefully way suppress error message. can use dbGetException see error sqliteTransactionStatement returns FALSE. dbConnect/sqliteNewConnection now throws error dbname argument NA. Previously, .character(NA) provided, database filename “NA” created. dbConnect/sqliteNewConnection now accepts two new arguments: flags: provides additional control connetion details. convenience, can specify one SQLITE_RWC (default), SQLITE_RW, SQLITE_RO obtain connection read/write/create, read/write, read mode, respectively. See http://sqlite.org/c3ref/open.html details. vfs: controls virtual filesystem used SQLite. default, NULL, lets SQLite select appropriate vfs system. can specify one “unix-posix”, “unix-afp”, “unix-flock”, “unix-dotfile”, “unix-none”. details, see https://www.sqlite.org/compile.html. functionality fully available OSX. non-OSX Unix, can use unix-dotfile unix-none. None modules available Windows non-NULL values vfs argument ignored warning.

title: Version 0.4-11
text: Implemented dbCommit() dbRollback(). also new generic method dbBeginTransaction(), begins transaction. Note extension DBI interface. Update SQLite 3 API fetching records. means records pulled database required, cached memory previously done. Added generic methods dbSendPreparedQuery() dbGetPreparedQuery() similar dbSendQuery() dbGetQuery(), take extra “bind.data” parameter, data frame. statement assumed contain bind variables. Bind variables either column name (“:name” “@name”) column index (“?”) data frame. See http://sqlite.org/capi3ref.html details. dbGetPreparedQuery(con, “INSERT table1 VALUES (:col1)”, data.frame(col1=c(1, 2)) ) bind variable query bound , either via named positional parameters. bound bound (due mix positional/named parameters) error thrown. extra columns data frame ignored. lot string parameters, use stringsAsFactors=FALSE creating bind.data data.frame instance. can also use (). Added experimental sqliteQuickColumn function retrieves entire column specified table quickly possible. SQLite driver new logical parameter “shared.cache” enable shared-cache mode, allows multiple connections share single data schema cache. See https://www.sqlite.org/sharedcache.html
